subject: Term 2 Class Bookings, Holiday Classes and Next Osteoporosis Workshops

full_threads.body:
Plus New Blog Post from Melinda
‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Hi Support,


Hello and welcome to Term 2!


We're excited to announce that Term 2 classes are now open for registration!


Whether you're returning for more or just getting started, there's something for everyone in our new line-up.


But that's not all-while Term 2 officially kicks off soon, we're keeping things moving with holiday classes running over the next two weeks. Perfect for staying active and connected between terms!


Also coming up: the next round of our popular Osteoporosis Workshops with Patrick-an excellent opportunity to learn, strengthen, and gain confidence. These sessions fill up fast, so book in early!


And don't miss the latest blog post from Melinda, diving into the fascinating world of pain science-what it is, why it matters, and how it can transform your approach to movement and recovery.


Let's make Term 2 your strongest yet. 💪

Term 2 Class Bookings Open



📅 Term 2 Classes Start the Week Of April 28


Now's the time to book your spot in one of our popular classes:

  • Clinical Exercise: Tailored programs to improve strength, balance, and function.
  • Healthy Bones: Strengthen your skeletal system in a safe, supportive environment.
  • Refit: Reignite your fitness with fun, low-impact workouts.
  • Yoga: Enhance flexibility, balance, and relaxation.
  • Qigong: Boost your energy and inner calm with this ancient mind-body practice.


💡 Tip: Classes fill up quickly, so secure your spot today!

To learn more or reserve your place, reply to this email or give us a call at 8021 2180

Click the link below to book your class. To book consecutive weeks, you will need to make 2 bookings.

**If you are doing multiple classes you can always email us for an invoice/payment link.

Osteoporosis Workshops: April 24 and May 8


These informative sessions will provide both education on osteoporosis management and practical group exercises to enhance bone health.


It's a great way to learn more about how you can take control of your bone health and prevent future issues.


Whether you're managing osteoporosis yourself or just want to learn more, this workshop is a great opportunity to deepen your understanding and get actionable tips for bone health.



Have you been diagnosed with Osteoporosis or Osteopenia?


Do you have a family history of low bone density?


Has your doctor recommended you start Osteoporosis medication, but you are reluctant?


Have you been advised to do strength training for your bone health but don't really know what that looks like?


Are you worried that you will stir up other injuries if you do strength work?



New Workshop Dates:


📅 Thursday, April 28th
🕐 Time: 5:30PM - 7:00PM


📅 Thursday, May 8th

🕐 Time: 1:00PM - 2:30PM


📍 Location: RedoHealth


Book Here.



Then join Patrick in this hour and half workshop as he:


Explores the principles of strength training with you

Explains how this helps to stimulate bone building to help with Osteopenia and Osteoporosis, and

Takes you through a practical session.


If you like what you have done in the workshop and it suits your needs, Patrick runs a Rebound for Healthy Bones class during our term of classes @ RedoHealth on Tuesday (930AM) and Thursdays (10:45AM and 6:00PM)


BOOK HERE

New On the Blog From Melinda - Embracing Pain Sciences


For people who come to my classes and clients who have been seeing me for a while, may have heard some of the stories I have retold from Lorimer Moseley; a physiotherapist first but now an incredibly widely published and authored Professor of Neuroscience.


These same people and others may also be aware that my husband Philip passed in mid 2023 from a two-year illness with brain cancer. In this time, he wrote a book about his life and his reckonings facing the prospect of an early departure, which was published three short weeks after he passed.


How on earth are these two points linked you may ask?


Read more here.




We can't wait to see you soon!


Yours in health,


The Team at Redo


Check out Our Latest Blogs
